wikipedia_page.main: Betty Huntley-Wright (3 December 1911 – 27 May 1993) was a British actress and vocalist.  Daughter of the comic actor Huntley Wright, she had a long career on stage, chiefly in comedy and pantomime, and in film, radio and television. Later she also ran an antiques business in London.

response: * Betty Huntley-Wright as Mrs. Twitchen in "Gourmet Night"
Betty Huntley-Wright as Elise
Wright's daughter, Betty Huntley-Wright, had a successful television and film career.

In 1898, Wright married the actress Christine Monica Margaret Taylor in London.See Certificate of Registration at GRO They separated in 1907 and were divorced in 1911. They had no children.The Times, 12 January 1911, p. 3 In the same year, Wright married Mary Smith, known by her stage name of Mary Fraser, the sister of actress Agnes Fraser, wife of the Savoyard Walter Passmore.Coincidentally, Passmore created the role of Hassan in The Rose of Persia, and Wright played the role in the 1927 BBC revival. They had three children, one of whom, Betty Huntley-Wright, went on to a successful television and film career.

Naughty Cinderella is a 1933 British comedy film directed by Jean Daumery and starring John Stuart, Winna Winifried and Betty Huntley-Wright.

Little Miss Nobody is a 1933 British comedy film directed by John Daumery, and starring Sebastian Shaw, Drusilla Wills, and Betty Huntley-Wright. The film was a quota quickie made at Teddington Studios by the British subsidiary of Warner Brothers.Chibnall p.272

On 1 June 1935 she featured in Bitter Sweet, a Romantic opera by Coward, adapted for the microphone supporting Anne Ziegler, also featuring Evelyn Laye, Betty Huntley-Wright, Patricia Burke, Patrick Waddington and Norah Howard.
